item.description: Update Traffic; INC#0844; 01:42PM; 1 World Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3v7KmIa; Westchester; After conducting the triage operation, firefighters determined there were a total of 23 passengers plus the driver on board. Two patients were transported in *at least* serious condition and seven patients were transported with minor, non-life threatening injuries. (no further patient information available) There was no entrapment and no fire hazard. All patients were onboard the shuttle, no one on the ground was injured. Any questions regarding the circumstances of the collision are referred to LAWA and LAPD. LA County Fire and El Segundo Fire also responded. ; FS 51; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 CM20 CM22 E205 E295 E51 E67 EM11 EM13 EM14 EM9 PI1 RA43 RA5 RA51 RA62 RA63 RA71 RA809 RA810 RA814 RA815 RA826 RA846 RA867 RA894 T5 T95; CH7; 14; Margaret Stewart

Traffic; INC#0844; 12:21PM; 1 World Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3v7KmIa; Westchester; A shuttle bus at LAX (exact ownership of the shuttle undetermined at this time) involved in a traffic collision. Initial reports of 30 persons on board and the majority of those did not sustain any injuries. There are two patients in *at least* serious condition. Firefighters are conducting a triage operation to determine the total number of patients and the extent of injuries (transports needed). Any LAX specific questions are referred to LAWA. ; FS 51; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 E205 E295 E51 E67 EM11 EM13 EM14 EM9 RA43 RA5 RA51 RA62 RA63 RA71 RA809 RA810 RA814 RA815 RA826 RA846 RA867 RA894 T5 T95; CH7; 14; Margaret Stewart

Brush Fire; INC#0802; 11:53AM; 15800 W Bailey Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3PPPvgd; outside city; Initial report of one acre of brush burning at the top of the ridge (near a shooting range). There are no structures threatened. This incident is in the jurisdiction of Angeles National Forest (within the Mutual Threat Zone) and LAFD is on scene as an assisting agency. Any further questions are referred to ANF follow @Angeles_NF ; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; BC12 BC15 CW3A CW3B E18 E275 E287 E289 E298 E77 E8139 E8140 E89 E91 EM12 H1 H4 H6 HA1 HA4 HA6 RA18 T75 T87 T89 T98; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0239; 05:34AM; 500 W Manchester Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3B3j35P; #VermontVista; *Corrected Address* LAFD arrived to find a 3,600 sq-ft commercial building erected in 1986 with heavy fire showing. Firefighters engaged in defensive operations, setting up ladder pipes and exterior hose lines, and established a "collapse zone" around the building (in case walls fell outward). There was, indeed, a collapse. Three firefighters were injured from debris that flew beyond the established collapse zone. Thankfully, two firefighters were evaluated and returned to work on the fire line. One firefighter, with a non-life threatening injury, was transported to the hospital for evaluation. It took 89 firefighters 42 minutes to extinguish the flames. LAFD Heavy Equipment is responding to assist with moving debris and locating smoldering materials underneath. The cause of the fire is under active investigation. ; FS 57; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC4 CM20 CM22 E10 E15 E205 E21 E210 E215 E221 E233 E264 E266 E33 E5 E57 E64 E66 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM13 HE1 HR3 RA257 RA264 RA5 RA57 RA857 SQ21 T10 T15 T21 T33 T5 T64 T66 UR5 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0982; 02:44PM; 5939 S Flower St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3RHRIMe; #VermontSlauson; It took 65 firefighters 38 minutes to extinguish the flames consuming an out building to the rear of a property, which spread to a two-story church. Firefighters limited the church's damage to the eave and slight attic involvement. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E21 E215 E221 E233 E264 E57 E64 EA1 EM13 HR3 RA64 RA814 RA833 RA857 SQ21 T15 T21 T33 T64 UR88; CH7; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Offensive mode.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC11 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E15 E21 E215 E221 E233 E264 E57 EM13 HR3 RA64 RA814 RA833 RA857 SQ21 T15 T21 T33 T64 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

Update Physical Rescue; INC#0434; 09:00AM; 10500 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ogd4mi; #BelAir; Firefighters rapidly completed extrication and two patients were transported to a local hospital (unknown age/gender/condition/circumstances) from the scene of a traffic collision with a concrete mixing truck on its side. LAPD Inc #1230. Nothing further.; FS 71; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 E19 E237 E292 E71 EM9 HR3 RA37 RA71 T37 T92 UR88; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Physical Rescue; INC#0434; 08:37AM; 10500 W Sunset Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ogd4mi; #BelAir; A traffic collision involving a concrete truck resulted in at least one patient trapped. Firefighters are working to extricate the patient.; FS 71; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 E19 E237 E292 E71 EM9 HR3 RA37 RA71 T37 T92 UR88; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1574; 09:12PM; 9537 N Laurel Canyon Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3ROKVQO; #Pacoima; The first 32 arriving firefighters extinguished the fire in 33 minutes. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC10 BC12 BC15 BC5 CM40 CM42 E227 E239 E27 E275 E289 E290 E298 E7 E75 E77 E89 EM14 EM15 HR3 RA27 RA75 RA827 RA898 T27 T39 T75 T89 T90 T98 UR27 UR88; CH8; 17 18; Nicholas Prange
